content: Did humans and non-avian dinosaurs coexist at any point in history?

No, humans and non-avian dinosaurs did not coexist at any point in history. Non-avian dinosaurs went extinct around 65 million years ago, while the earliest known human species emerged only about 2.8 million years ago. This means there is a significant gap of millions of years between the extinction of non-avian dinosaurs and the appearance of humans on Earth.
